head.title: Trotsky Tale Coincides With a Visit by Grandson

hedline.hl1: Trotsky Tale Coincides With a Visit by Grandson

abstract.p: Peter Meyer Filardo letter on September 17 FYI item on Leon Trotsky notes he will host conference of history of US Trotskyism at New York University (S)

block.p: Your F.Y.I. report on Leon Trotsky (''Red Star in the Bronx,'' Sept. 17), reminded me of my socialist-yid dishist grandfather's claim that he attended a farewell banquet to celebrate Trotsky's departure from New York for Russia in March 1917. In my Communist parents' milieu, Trotsky was a counterrevolutionary traitor, if not the Antichrist.

Today, as archivist of the Tamiment Institute Library at New York University, a special collection on American radicalism, I find myself hosting a conference on the history of United States Trotskyism this coming weekend, Friday through Sunday. Among the speakers will be Trotsky's grandson, Esteban Volkov, head of the Leon Trotsky Museum in Mexico City and the son of one of Trotsky's daughters from his first marriage. For information, you can inquire at (212) 998-2639 or from peter.filardo@nyu.edu.
